source_sentence: 餓鬼報應經
translation: Sutra on the Retribution of Hungry Ghosts

source_sentence: 失譯附東晉錄
translation: Lost in Translation with the Catalogue of the Eastern Jin dynasty

source_sentence: 尊者大目揵連，從佛在耆闍崛山中，遊行恒水邊，見諸餓鬼甚多，受罪不同。
translation: Venerable Mahāmaudgalyāyana traveled from the Buddha's abode on Mount Gṛdhrakūṭa to the edge of the Gaṅgā River and saw a large number of hungry ghosts who were suffering from different kinds of sins.

source_sentence: 見尊者目連，皆起敬心，來問因緣。
translation: When they saw Venerable Maudgalyāyana, they all arose in respect and came to ask about the causes and conditions.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我常苦頭痛，不知何罪所致？」
translation: One ghost asked, "I'm always suffering from headaches; I wonder what sin caused that?"

source_sentence: 目連答言：「汝本為人時，不能修忍，以杖打眾生頭，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Mucilin answered, "When you were originally a human being, you couldn't cultivate patience and struck the heads of sentient beings with a stick; now you'll receive the results of your actions, which will land you in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我常瘡痛，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I always have sores and pains, what's the cause of my sins?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，無有慈心，焚燒山野，殘害眾生，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you lacked compassion, burned mountains and fields, and killed sentient beings; now you'll receive the results of your actions, which will land you in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我舉身瘡爛，不可堪忍，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "My body is covered in sores and rotten, which is unbearable; what was the sin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，喜燂猪羊，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you liked to eat pigs and sheep; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我食無足，初不得飽，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I didn't have enough to eat, and I wasn't able to get enough to eat in the first place; what was the reason?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，雖飯眾生，恒令不足，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "Although you fed sentient beings when you were a human being, you always made it inadequate; now you'll receive the results of your flowering and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我常苦頭痛，治之叵差，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've always had painful headaches, and I've been treated poorly; what's the cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，不敬道德，加以罵辱，今受花報，果在地獄」。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you disrespected morality and ridiculed it; now you'll be punished with flowers and the result will be hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我生男女，盡皆端正可愛，而皆早死，念無斷絕，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was born a man and a woman who were both decent and lovely, but I died young and my mindfulness wasn't cut off; what crime did that cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，見兒殺生，助喜噉肉，殺故促命，喜故痛毒，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you saw your child killing beings and helped delight in eating meat; killing prompts death, and delight causes pain and poison; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and find yourself in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我有一夫，而畜多婦，我應直宿，而不見納，何罪所致？」
translation: A demon asked, "I have one husband and many wives to feed, and I should have stayed straight overnight but didn't see them accepted.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，不敬夫主，邪婬無禮，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you dishonored your husband's master and engaged in sexual misconduct and rudeness; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我常頭痛，而男根瘡爛，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I always have headaches, and my male faculties are sores and rotted; what's the cause of this sin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，於塔廟清淨之處行婬，今受花報果，在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you engaged in sexual misconduct in a pure place like a stūpa, and now you've been rewarded with flowers and are in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我得此身，麁澁不淨，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "What crime did I commit in attaining this body, which is crude and impure?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，不尊有德，輕賤善人，而以沙土擲坌沙門，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you didn't honor virtuous people and despised good people, so you threw sand and dirt on the monks.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我食不啻一斛，而常不足，何罪所致？」
translation: A demon asked, "I eat no less than a tub of food, but it's always insufficient; what's the sin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，本作比丘，為僧求物，而以自食，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were originally a monk who asked for things for the saṃgha and fed yourself; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此形，脚腫項癭，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "What crime did I commit in getting this shape and having swollen feet and a burr?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，使人及諸畜生負重無道，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you burdened humans and other animals with a heavy burden and no path; now you'll receive the results of your efforts in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常患熱渴，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been subjected to this body, and I'm always suffering from fever and thirst; what's the cause of this sin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，喜好漁獵，以所得魚，投之沙土，令其苦死，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you liked fishing and hunting, and you threw the fish you caught into the sand and soil, causing them to die a painful death; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，狂癡無智，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was born in this body, deluded and without wisdom; what crime did that cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，以酒施人，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you gave alcohol to others; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我所生子，皆反噉我，何罪所致？」
translation: A demon asked, "What's the crime of having sons born to me who eat me back?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，不修孝養，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you didn't cultivate filial piety; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我食常吐，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I always vomit when I eat; what's the sin?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，有人中後索食，汝瞋罵而與，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, someone asked you for food after you were in the middle, and you gave it to them in anger; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and the result will be hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我今一生資財無乏，而樂著弊衣，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "Now, I've had nothing to lose all my life, but I enjoy wearing poor clothing.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，雖好布施，施後尋悔，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "Although you were a human being who liked to give alms and regretted it afterward, now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受一形，恒倚巷陌，宿無常處，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "What crime did I commit when I received a form that was always standing on a street and stayed in an impermanent place?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，客來投止而不安隱，見他容止而復瞋罵，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were unsettled when visitors came to stay, and you were angry when you saw the way others looked and behaved.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我得此形，非男非女，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I got this form, and it's neither male nor female; what crime did it cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，而無慈心，好犍六畜，今受花報，果在地獄」。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you lacked compassion and liked to bullock six animals; now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我得此身，躄不能行，何罪所致？」
translation: A demon asked, "I got this body, and I'm crippled and unable to walk; what was the reason?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時好行無道，拘繫人獸令不得行，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you liked to practice the pathlessness and held humans and animals captive so that they couldn't practice. Now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我此一身常患熱渴，行見恒河，清涼美好，入中洗浴，冀得涼樂，以除熱苦；方入其中，舉身爛壞，渴欲飲之，一口入咽，五藏焦爛，肌肉離骨。
translation: A ghost asked, "I'm always suffering from fever and thirst, and when I walk along and see the Ganges River, which is cool and beautiful, I enter it to bathe, hoping to get cool and happy so I can get rid of the fever and suffering.

source_sentence: 何罪所致？」
translation: What sin did that cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，好為相師，相人吉凶，少實多虛，或毀或譽，自稱有德，以動人心，以求利養。
translation: He replied, "When you were a person, you liked to be a fortuneteller, judged people's fortune and misfortune, were little real and much unreal, and either disparaged or praised them, claiming to be virtuous in order to move people's minds and seek profit.

source_sentence: 又於父母、兄弟、宗親諂偽不實，今受花報。
translation: You also flattered your parents, brothers, and clansmen by being false and untruthful, and now you'll receive the results of flowers.

source_sentence: 果在地獄，受苦億倍，說不可盡。」
translation: If I were to end up in hell, I'd experience suffering a billion times over, which is inexplicable."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受身以來。
translation: A ghost asked, "Ever since I was born.

source_sentence: 常有惡狗，體大牙利、兩目赫赤，晝夜常來而噉我身，命未盡頃肉尋復生，復受此苦，痛不可忍，何罪所致？」
translation: A dangerous dog with large, sharp teeth and red eyes used to come back day and night and eat my body before my life ended and find its flesh again.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作天祠主，於天祠中，取牛羊血以祀於天，自食其肉，語眾人言：『汝等祀天，大得吉利！』
translation: He answered, "When you were a human being, you were the director of a celestial shrine, and in that shrine you took the blood of cattle and sheep and sacrificed it to the gods, ate their own flesh, and said to the people, 'It's very fortunate that you sacrifice to the gods!'

source_sentence: 作諸惡邪以惑百姓，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He did all these evil deeds to confuse the people, and now he'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常在不淨中，舉身塗漫，有所噉食皆是不淨，恒受此苦，不能得離，臭惱纏身，憂患叵計，何罪所致？」
translation: A demon asks, "I've been subjected to this body, which is always impure, and I've been smeared with body paint and devoured by things that are impure.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作婆羅門，不信佛法，不樂供養沙門、道人，若來乞求，恒不欲見。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you became a brāhmaṇa, didn't believe in the Buddha's teaching, didn't enjoy making offerings to ascetics and religious practitioners, and never wanted to see anyone who came begging.

source_sentence: 時有一道人來從汝乞。
translation: Then, there was a man of the Way who came to ask for alms from you.

source_sentence: 汝作是念：『當作方便，令不復來。』
translation: You thought, 'This is a way to keep him from coming back.'

source_sentence: 即取鉢盛屎著下，以飯覆上，將與道人。
translation: He then took a bowl, put some excrement under it, covered it with rice, and gave it to the religious man.

source_sentence: 道人得已，還至本處，持著一面，淨洗手訖，坐而執鉢，手取欲食，鉢中不淨，臭不可近。
translation: After he got it, the religious man went back to his original place, held it to one side, washed his hands clean, sat down with the bowl, and tried to eat it with his hand, but the bowl was impure and smelled unapproachable.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，受此臭惱，今受花報，果在地獄，常吞熱鐵丸，身體爛壞，苦不可言。」
translation: Because of this cause and condition, he was afflicted by this stench, and now he'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell, where he'll always swallow hot iron pellets and his body will rot and become unspeakably painful."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，處處舌出，有自然斧，而斬截之，如是無數，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been subjected to this body, and my tongue has come out everywhere, and there's a natural ax that cuts it off like this, which is countless; what crime did it cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作小道人，為僧所差，取冷淨水，作石蜜漿，分與眾僧。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you became a junior monk and were sent by the saṃgha to get some cold, clean water and make rock honey syrup, which he distributed to the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 石蜜堅大，打取少許，盜食一口。
translation: The rock honey was strong and large, so you beat it a little and stole a mouthful.

source_sentence: 盜僧物故，今受花報，果在地獄，吞注洋銅，苦不可言。」
translation: Stealing the saṃgha's property led to the flower retribution now, which is the result of being sent to hell, where I swallowed foreign copper and suffered unspeakably."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常苦飢餓，往至廁上，欲取屎食。
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been suffering from hunger since I was born in this body, so I went up to the toilet to get some excrement to eat.

source_sentence: 廁上有大力鬼，以杖打我，初不得近，何罪所致？」
translation: There's a powerful demon on the toilet that beats me with a stick and won't let me come near it in the first place.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，曾作道人，為佛圖主，悋護僧物，不以好食供養眾僧，常以麁惡與之。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you once became a Wayfarer and a buddha image master who guarded the property of the saṃgha and didn't serve good food to the saṃgha but always gave them unwholesome food.

source_sentence: 或時時欲作好食，客比丘來，便止不作，待去乃設。
translation: Sometimes when you want to prepare a meal, a visiting monk comes along, so you stop making it and wait until he leaves before setting it up.

source_sentence: 惡心慳惜，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Being stingy with evil intentions, now I'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，腹大如甕，餘身分皆小，咽如細針孔，不得下食，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body, and my belly was as big as a jar, while the rest of my body was small, and my throat was like a tiny needle hole, so I couldn't get down to eat; what was the reason?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作聚落主，自恃豪強，欺人民，常以無道索人飲食，以苦百姓，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were a village leader who relied on your strength, deceived the people, and often asked people for food and drink without a path in order to make them miserable.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，肩上有銅瓶，滿中洋銅，手捉一杓，以酌取之，自灌其頭，舉身焦爛，如是無數，苦痛無量，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "When I was born in this body, I had a copper vase on my shoulder that was filled with copper, and I grabbed a ladle in my hand, used it to pour water over my head, and it scorched my body, causing countless such pains and suffering.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，出家修道，知僧飲食，以一酥瓶，藏著餘處，客道人來而不與之，客去出酥行與舊僧。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being and left home to practice, you knew what the saṃgha ate and hid a jar of butter in a different place, and a guest came along and didn't give it to him; the guest then took the butter out and gave it to the old saṃgha.

source_sentence: 此酥是招提僧物，一切有分，隱匿僧物，與不平等。
translation: This butter is a property of solicited monks, and all who have a share in it and hide it from the monks are not equal.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，得如是苦，今受花報，果在地獄，受苦難計。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, I've attained such suffering, and now I'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell, where my suffering is incalculable."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常有人來，持諸刀鋸，割剝我身，又破其腹，出其五藏，肉盡筋斷，痛不可忍。
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body when someone came along with a knife and saw, cut me off, broke open my belly, and took out my five stores, cutting off all my flesh and cutting off my tendons, which caused unbearable pain.

source_sentence: 須臾之間，肉生平復，尋復來割，何罪所致？」
translation: In a moment's time, my flesh recovers, and then I find someone who comes back and cuts me again. What crime did that cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作婆羅門，不信正法，常生邪見，奉事天神，恒以牛羊禱祠，以是罪故，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you became a brāhmaṇa, didn't believe in the right teaching, always had wrong views, served the gods, and always prayed to them with cattle and sheep.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常有人來，持諸刀鋸，割剝我身，又破其腹，出其五藏，肉盡筋斷，苦切叵忍。
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body when someone came along with a knife and saw, cut me off, broke open my belly, and took out my five stores, cutting off my flesh and cutting off my tendons, which was painful and unbearable.

source_sentence: 須臾之間，肉生平復，尋復來割，何罪所致？」
translation: In a moment's time, my flesh grows back, and then I find someone who comes back to cut it off again.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，常作魁膾，主知殺人無有慈心，歡喜行之，有如是罪，故得此惡，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were always a chief cutter, and the lord knew that you had no compassion for killing people and rejoiced in doing it.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，兩腋下恒有熱鐵輪轉，大熱逼身兩腋焦爛，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been subjected to this body, and there's a constant hot iron turning under my armpits, which causes a great heat to force my body to scorch my armpits.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，出家學道，與僧作種種餅，僧未下食，汝時貪心盜取僧餅，藏著腋下屏處食之，以是因緣得如是苦，今受花報，果在地獄，受苦難量。」
translation: You replied, "When you were a human being, you left home to train on the path and made various kinds of cakes for the saṃgha. Before the saṃgha descended to eat them, you greedily stole the saṃgha's cakes and hid them under your armpit where you could screen them and eat them.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，常有自然赤鐵丸，從空中下，入口至腹，或從左出右入，或從右出左入，舉身焦爛，痛切無量，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been subjected to this body, which always has a natural red iron ball that falls from the sky, enters my mouth and stomach, exits from the left and enters the right, or exits from the right and enters the left, scorches my body, and causes immeasurable pain. What's the cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，出家為沙彌，為僧煮菴羅果。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you left home and became a novice monk to cook maṇḍala fruit for the saṃgha.

source_sentence: 僧中行之，至和上前，輒長與七枚。
translation: When you practiced among the saṃgha and went up to the monastery, you would often be given seven of them.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，得如是惡，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Because of this cause and condition, you did this evil, and now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，意欲行來，發動迴還，猶如旋風，初不得前，愁惱悶苦，不可稱計，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body with the intention of traveling here, but I started to turn back like a whirlwind, and when I first didn't get here, I was so sad and distressed that I couldn't even begin to tell you what crime it caused."

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作卜問師，詭誑他人，令心罔惑，或喜或怖，皆不真實，由此因緣，得如是惡，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you acted as a diviner and deceived others, causing your mind to be confused and either joyous or fearful, but none of them were real; this was the cause and condition that led to such evil, which now brings the results of flowers and lands you in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，內常有熱，猶懷湯火，復來燒煮，苦痛萬端，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I've been subjected to this body, which always has internal heat, just like carrying hot water and fire, and I'm burned again, which causes a lot of pain.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作國王第一夫人。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were the king's first wife.

source_sentence: 時王貴敬小夫人，汝常生嫉心，作惡方便，求欲殺之。
translation: The king then revered the youngest wife, but you were always jealous and created bad intentions to kill her.

source_sentence: 伺其臥時，煮酥令熱，注著腹上。
translation: When she's lying down, boil some butter and make it hot, then pour it on her belly.

source_sentence: 其人得此苦痛無量，遂便命終。
translation: She experiences this pain, which is incalculable, and then her life ends.

source_sentence: 由是因緣，得如是苦，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, he attains this kind of suffering, which now brings the results of flowers and lands him in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，性多恐怖，常畏人來，收閉繫縛、枷鎖楚毒，初無歡心，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was born with this body, which is by nature terrifying, always fearful of people coming, bound and chained to it, and painful, and never happy at first.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，好行邪婬，犯人婦女，常畏發覺，心不自寧，今受花報，果在地獄，或臥鐵床或抱銅柱，如是之苦，不可稱計。」
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you were fond of committing sexual misconduct, imprisoned women, were always afraid to find out, and had no peace of mind.

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，自然熱鐵，而有籠網，纏絡我身，燒熱焦爛，痛毒叵言，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was subjected to this body, which is naturally made of hot iron, and there's a cage and net that wraps around my body, burning it hot and scorching it, and causing pain that's indescribable. What crime was that?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，常持罝網，殺諸魚獸，籠取飛鳥。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you always used to carry a net, kill fish and animals, and cage flying birds.

source_sentence: 以是因緣，得如是苦切，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, you attained such painful rewards, and now you'll be rewarded with flowers and end up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，無有手足，如一叚肉，在於曠野，狐狼虎豹，鵰鷲眾鳥，競來搏撮，爭共食之，苦痛叵言，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body, which has no hands or feet, like a coarse piece of flesh that's out in the wilderness, where foxes, wolves, tigers, leopards, eagles, and birds compete to pick it up and eat it together.

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，作惡方便，若己若他，妊身之時，即便與藥，令胎消化。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, you did bad deeds, whether for yourself or others, and when you were expecting a baby, you gave it medicine to make the womb digest.

source_sentence: 由是因緣，得如是苦，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, you'll experience such suffering and now be subject to the flower retribution and result in hell."

source_sentence: 又三鬼一時來問言：「我受此身，常有鐵釘，從空中下，釘我身上，入肌破骨，痛毒徹髓，何罪所致？」
translation: Three more demons came along at one point and asked, "What crime did I commit when I was given this body and iron nails rained down from the sky and pinned me, penetrating my muscles and bones and causing pain and venom to penetrate my marrow?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，一人作馬師，一人作牛師，一人作象師。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, one of you was a horse mentor, another was a cow mentor, and another was an elephant mentor.

source_sentence: 苟貪他財，鍼刺無道，使受痛苦，而不除痛，由是因緣，得如是苦，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: If you covet another's wealth and stab them without the path, causing pain and not removing the pain, this is the cause and condition that brings such suffering, which now brings the results of flowers and ends up in hell."

source_sentence: 一鬼問言：「我受此身，無有頭首，眼耳鼻口，盡在胸前，何罪所致？」
translation: A ghost asked, "I was given this body, which has no head, and my eyes, ears, nose, and mouth are all in front of my chest; what crime did that cause?"

source_sentence: 答言：「汝為人時，若見殺人，與之捉頭，歡喜而挽，無有慈心。
translation: He replied, "When you were a human being, if you saw a killer and gave him your head, you rejoiced and pulled him back, lacking compassion.

source_sentence: 由是因緣，得如是身，今受花報，果在地獄。」
translation: Because of these causes and conditions, you got such a body, and now you'll be rewarded with flowers and the result will be in hell."

source_sentence: 目連答諸鬼已，皆生敬心，走前懺悔。
translation: After Maudgalyāyana answered the demons, they all became respectful and went forward to repent.

source_sentence: 目連見其歡喜，更為說法。
translation: Seeing them rejoice, Maudgalyāyana then explained the teaching to them.

source_sentence: 諸鬼聞已，皆大歡喜。
translation: After the demons heard this, they were all overjoyed.

source_sentence: 餓鬼報應經
translation: Sutra on the Retribution of Hungry Ghosts
